Class Food

java.lang.Object
lab9.Food
public class Food extends Object
Class representing a food entr√©e that may, for example, be served in a cafeteria. Each instance stores the name, the food group it belongs to, the energy content (in kilocalories, hereinafter Calories) & what percentage of the daily recommended value the food represents. The daily percentage is stored as a floating-point number but displayed as a percentage rounded to the nearest whole number. The class stores a small amount of information specific to the lab it was created for (see readme) in order to facilitate terminal output. Getter & setter methods are only documented where non-trivial.

    • STRING_DEFAULT

      public static final String STRING_DEFAULT
      Default value for String fields of instances of this class.

      • Constant Field Values

    • tableHeaders

      public static final String[] tableHeaders
      Ordered array of headers corresponding to each field for terminal display.

    • columnWidths

      public static int[] columnWidths
      Ordered array of widths corresponding to each display column for terminal output. Originally initialized to the width of the Strings in tableHeaders, inputting values via fromTextLine updates the widths.

    • percent

      protected static NumberFormat percent
      Used to format daily for terminal output.

  • Constructor Details

    • Food

      public Food()
      Default constructor: sets name & group = STRING_DEFAULT, kcal=0 & daily=0.0

    • Food

      public Food(String name, String group, int kcal, double daily)
      Full constructor. Uses setters to validate all passed data.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the food
      group - Food group it belongs to
      kcal - The amount of energy in Calories in a serving of the food
      daily - Daily recommended percentage of the food per serving

  • Method Details

    • fromTextLine

      public static Food fromTextLine(String line)
      Class method to create a Food instance from a line of text input. Automatically updates columnWidths as necessary. Throws an InputMismatchException for a null line, not having 4 space-separated values, or inconsistencies in the numerical types.
      Parameters:
      line - A single line of text containing a Food item. Expects String String int double, single space-delimited.
      Returns:
      a Food item based on the data

      public String toString()
